text: Mind if I join you? I'm Clive.
Clive Bixby.
Yes, I can see that. I'm Juliana.

So, Clive, you in town for a convention, 
or do you just forget your name a lot?
Pretty kitty has nails. I like that.
I'm in town for a trade show.
I design high end electroacoustic transducers.
Wow. That is very specific.

It's a fancy way of saying I get things to make 
noise.
Mm.

So what's your story? Miss America pageant in 
town?

Well, you're a pretty smooth talker, 
Clive.
I'm pretty smooth all over.
Oh.
I had a whole private dinner plan.
I don't know what happened.
But I do. I know exactly what happened.
No you don't. I.
What the hell?
I win!
I see you sneaking around trying to trick me.

So when I figure it out, 
I move the party over here and I trick you.
I win!
What do you mean, you win?
I know you think I think you're not romantic, but I think you think I'm not smarter than you.
So now we know you are romantic.
And I'm smarter than you.
And I bought you a motorcycle.
My God, it's fantastic!
I win again.

Honey, I love all this but you can't win 
Valentine's Day.

I mean, you defeat the whole idea if you make it 
into some silly competition.
Shut up, I win.
Hey. Margaret said you keep the phone records.
Why? What do you need them for?
Still trying to find out who sent me those flowers. You keep them in here?
No, don't! Don't. Hmm.

Ben, why do you have this photo of me 
in your desk drawer?
I think someone's pranking me.

Probably. Okay.
- I'm gonna go.
Wait. Look, I sent the flowers,

okay? When you temped here last summer, 
I became tempted by your charms.

Well, thank you, but aren't you, 
like, 40?
What? I'm 26! I. I had a Sweet Tart addiction when I was a kid,
and I permanently damaged my collagen.

Wow. I've been in a series of bizarre, 
shameful relationships.
You work for my mother. You still live at home.

Look at all those medications. Kiss me. 
- What?
Whoa! Okay, that was very cool.
But you should know that I have dedicated my life to closets.
I am obsessed with your grandfather.

And I sleep with a body pillow that I put a 
nightgown on.
Stop. You're making it better.
You mean this watch?
The Houdini handcuffs.

I've been taking magic lessons as a Valentine's 
surprise.

Wait a minute. The supposed hinge salesman at your 
office.
The Great Majesto.

Of course, I didn't recognize him without his 
floor length robe covered in question marks.

And we also really do have a reservation at that 
really nice place down the street.
So we should probably get your check.
Excuse me, can we get the check?
But are you really dressed for?
So wonderful!
Oh. Oh, come on, honey, we should get going.
Wait, uh, do you have the key?
No, but you do.
I don't deserve you.
You know, the first two years we were together,
we were insanely romantic.
And then it became about parenting and working.

And this last year, we got that back, 
and I just realized I've dropped the ball.

Oh, no. Maybe you. You shouldn't be the only one 
carrying the ball.
What if you did a give off to me?
A hand off.

Okay. Yeah. Look, what if I tried to become a 
little bit more romantic?
What would that even look like?

This song. This song was playing the night I asked you to move in.
- At that Applebee's.
Oh.
I believe you owe me a dance.
Yes.

You finish that drink, pretty lady. We got a big 
night ahead of us.
Okay.
First we have a date with a romance.
A threesome, if you will.

From here, we move on to
an old fashioned blimpnic.
Now, is that the one where the man has to face out with the woman?
It's a picnic on a blimp.

Mm. Champagne, cheese and
this beautiful city beneath us.
Actually sounds really romantic.

After that, we swap our earplugs for some ear 
muffs.

Take a few moonlit turns around the local ice 
rink.
Oh. Oh.
